Chapters: Taraki Sivaram, J. S. Tissainayagam, Richard de Zoysa, Selvarajah Rajivarnam, Mylvaganam Nimalrajan, Aiyathurai Nadesan, Sinnathamby Sivamaharajah, K. S. Raja, Relangi Selvarajah, Subramaniyam Sugirdharajan, David Jeyaraj, Mariathas Manojanraj, Maunasami Parameswaree, Balanadarajah Iyer, P. Devakumaran, S. P. Mylvaganam, Suresh Kumar and Ranjith Kumar, Chandrabose Suthaharan, Sahathevan Nilakshan, Tim Horshington. Excerpt: A hyperlinked version of this chapter is at Kandasamy Balanadarajah Iyer also known as Sinna Bala (June 6, 1957 - August 16, 2004) was a Sri Lankan Tamil activist and writer who served as the media secretary for the Eelam People's Democratic Party . Personal life He was born in Uralu, Jaffna on June 6, 1957 to Veeramani Iyer, a member of Jaffna's small Tamil Brahmin community. He began his political activities in 1972 with the Tamil Students Organization . He was married to Jegatheswari Balanadarajah and had three daughters: Madhura, Abhira, and Viveka . Political life A hyperlinked version of this chapter is at Chandrabose Suthaharan Ta Chandrabose Suthaharan was a minority Sri Lankan Tamil editor of the Tamil magazine Nilam and he also wrote for other Tamil News Media.He had earlier worked for Virakesari . He was shot dead on April 16, 2007 in Thirunavatkulam in Vavuniya . Background His killing is part of series of killing,abduction and attacks on Journalists in Sri Lanka. It was also seen as part of the intimidation of Tamil media. Incident A hyperlinked version of this chapter is at David Jeyaraj David Buell Jeyaraj (born: May 21, 1954) is a freelance Canadian journalist . His articles appear under the name D.B.S Jeyaraj, the initials stand for David Buell Sabapathy.
